bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 168, Number 70 (Thursday, April 28, 2022)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. McCAUL:H.R. 7630.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantfollowing:Article 1, Section 8[Page H4609]

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.
Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

summary.text:
Childhood Cancer Survivorship, Treatment, Access, and Research Reauthorization Act of 2022 or the Childhood Cancer STAR Reauthorization Act

This bill reauthorizes through FY2028 and modifies pediatric cancer research and related programs, including to expand collection of and access to relevant biospecimens and to support the transition of pediatric cancer survivors to primary care.

bill.title: Childhood Cancer STAR Reauthorization Act of 2022

item.title: Childhood Cancer STAR Reauthorization Act of 2022
Childhood Cancer STAR Reauthorization Act of 2022
Childhood Cancer Survivorship, Treatment, Access, and Research Reauthorization Act of 2022
To maximize discovery, and accelerate development and availability, of promising childhood cancer treatments, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
